catalog_info.prereq: Recommended: French 50 or another French course at the 50 level; 751-780 on the SAT II or the Harvard placement test; or permission of course head.
catalog_info.description: This course examines the concept of a "French identity" from the principles of the Enlightenment to the contemporary debates and political controversies about national identity. Through the exploration of historical, literary, sociological and philosophical texts, as well as film and multimedia resources, we will focus on individuals, symbolic places, ideological discourses and narratives that have contributed to the formation and questioning of a French national identity.
